intro: Sulcorebutia fischeriana, commonly known as the Fischer's stonecress, is a species of flowering plant in the family Portulacaceae. It is native to the arid regions of South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. This succulent plant is characterized by its compact, mound-like growth habit and fleshy, ribbed stems. Its small, star-shaped flowers are typically pink or purple, blooming in spring. Sulcorebutia fischeriana is well adapted to dry environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems.
